headline: Palantir Announces Renewal of Multi-Year Contract with the DGSI
summary: PARIS, December 15, 2025--Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: PLTR) announces a three-year renewal of its contract with the DGSI, France's domestic intelligence agency, extending a partnership that has been ongoing for nearly a decade. This agreement relates to the supply of Palantir’s proprietary software platform, as well as the integration, support, and assistance services that are necessary for the software’s deployment and operational use.

content.title: Palantir Announces Renewal of Multi-Year Contract with the DGSI
content.summary: PARIS, December 15, 2025--Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: PLTR) announces a three-year renewal of its contract with the DGSI, France's domestic intelligence agency, extending a partnership that has been ongoing for nearly a decade. This agreement relates to the supply of Palantir’s proprietary software platform, as well as the integration, support, and assistance services that are necessary for the software’s deployment and operational use.

headline: The AI Application Giant Prints Cash at 51% Margins While the Data Warehouse Burns Through Hundreds of Millions
summary: Palantir (NYSE: PLTR) and Snowflake (NYSE: SNOW) just reported earnings revealing two companies attacking AI from opposite ends of the stack. Palantir posted 63% revenue growth with 51% operating margins. Snowflake grew 29% but burns cash with a negative 27% operating margin. One Prints Cash While Building AI Applications. The Other Burns It Building Infrastructure. ... The AI Application Giant Prints Cash at 51% Margins While the Data Warehouse Burns Through Hundreds of Millions

summary: As the U.S. market grapples with fluctuating indices and AI bubble concerns, the Dow Jones Industrial Average recently hit an all-time high before retreating, while tech-heavy stocks like those in the Nasdaq face pressure amid broader economic uncertainties. headline: Nvidia unveils new open-source AI models amid boom in Chinese offerings
summary: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a new family of open-source artificial intelligence models that it says will be faster, cheaper and ​smarter than its previous offerings, as open-source offerings from Chinese AI labs proliferate.  Nvidia ‌is primarily known for providing chips that firms such as OpenAI use to train their closed-source models and ‌charge money for them.  Nvidia ⁠on Monday revealed the third ‌generation of its "Nemotron" large-language models aimed at writing, coding and other tasks.

content.title: Nvidia unveils new open-source AI models amid boom in Chinese offerings
content.summary: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a new family of open-source artificial intelligence models that it says will be faster, cheaper and ​smarter than its previous offerings, as open-source offerings from Chinese AI labs proliferate.  Nvidia ‌is primarily known for providing chips that firms such as OpenAI use to train their closed-source models and ‌charge money for them.  Nvidia ⁠on Monday revealed the third ‌generation of its "Nemotron" large-language models aimed at writing, coding and other tasks.

headline: Jim Siders Joins Shield Technology Partners as Chief Executive Officer
summary: NEW YORK, December 15, 2025--Shield Technology Partners ("Shield") today announced the appointment of Jim Siders as Chief Executive Officer. Shield is an IT services platform that combines frontier AI, product and engineering capabilities, with operational and M&A expertise to help businesses grow on their terms.

content.title: Jim Siders Joins Shield Technology Partners as Chief Executive Officer

Shield is an IT services platform that combines frontier AI, product and engineering capabilities, with operational and M&A expertise to help businesses grow on their terms.

headline: US stocks drift ahead of a week full of economic updates
summary: Wall Street is drifting in mixed trading on Monday at the start of a week full of economic reports that could drive where interest rates, and thus stock prices, go.  The S&P 500 was virtually unchanged in morning trading, coming off its first losing week in the last three.

headline: Poor People 'Pay The Price For Being Wrong' — Palantir CEO Alex Karp Blasts Leaders Getting Huge Bonuses After 'Stupid Decisions' And Government Help
summary: Poor people keep paying the price for being wrong while powerful leaders collect huge rewards. Executives avoid consequences for failures that would bring severe penalties for ordinary Americans. "No one believes the institutions are credible … and I struggle to believe they're credible too," Palantir Technologies Inc. (NYSE:PLTR) CEO Alex Karp recently said at The New York Times DealBook Summit. He added, "We at Palantir absorb the full risk of our failure," describing what he sees as a widenin

headline: Stock Market News for Dec 15, 2025
summary: U.S. stocks ended lower on Friday, with investors dumping technology stocks and taking refuge in value assets as concerns grew over an AI bubble and Treasury yields rose after some Federal Reserve policymakers raised concerns over risks of lower borrowing costs.

content.title: Stock Market News for Dec 15, 2025
content.summary: U.S. stocks ended lower on Friday, with investors dumping technology stocks and taking refuge in value assets as concerns grew over an AI bubble and Treasury yields rose after some Federal Reserve policymakers raised concerns over risks of lower borrowing costs.

headline: US High Growth Tech Stocks to Watch
summary: The United States market has recently experienced declines in major stock indexes, with technology shares exerting downward pressure on the Nasdaq amid concerns about an AI bubble. In this environment, identifying high-growth tech stocks involves looking for companies that demonstrate strong innovation potential and resilience against broader market volatility.
